name: A. Permutation Forgery
statement:
A permutation of length n is an array consisting of n distinct integers
from 1 to n in arbitrary order. For example, [2,3,1,5,4] is a
permutation, but [1,2,2] is not a permutation (2 appears twice in the
array) and [1,3,4] is also not a permutation (n=3 but there is 4 in the
array).Let p be any permutation of length n. We define the F(p) of p as
the sorted array of sums of adjacent elements in p. More formally,F(p)=
mathrm{sort}([p_1+p_2,p_2+p_3,
ldots,p_{n-1}+p_n]).For example, if n=4 and p=[1,4,2,3], then the
fingerprint is given by F(p)=
mathrm{sort}([1+4,4+2,2+3])=
mathrm{sort}([5,6,5])=[5,5,6].You are given a permutation p of length n.
Your task is to find a permutation p’ with the same fingerprint. Two
permutations p and p’ are considered different if there is some index i
such that p_i
ne p’_i.
